answers.answer: Dear jim P,the adkins diet may cause acidosis or a chimical buil up of acid in the blood stream and this may irritate the heart or cuase abnormal rhythms.It would be important to make sure that there are no underlying cuases for this by having your heart fully evaluated and I would stop the adkins diet and followup with your physician for a physician supervised weight loss program.

Dear Jim,A possible cause for your condition is "Lactic Acidosis".  Certain people are genetically or physically vulnerable(due to disease in combination with diet and dehydration).  This is only one of many causes(dehydration, hypovulymia-low plasma volume, heart/lung disease, etc.) for shortness of breadth, and I am interested in the doctor's response also.Sincerely,Ginny
Hi Ginny!How do you know so much about the heart?  Are you a nurse or something having to do with the medical field.  Thanks for all your input.Take care,Carrie

Dear Carrie,I am not a medical professional in any capacity.  I have a medical condition that makes me vulnerable to Heart Disease, Lung Disease, Kidney Disease, joint and connective tissue disease, and CNS and peripheral nervous system disease.  Because of this, I have done a lot of research/reading on these subjects.  I also have a Husband who has heart disease, Diabetes, and Arthritis.And a daughter who has endocrinological disease, heart problems, and joint disease.  And my son has GERD and possible asthma.  Members of my family have had lung disease, bowel disease, cancer, women's diseases, hematological diseases, Gout, CHF, MI,Stroke, Allergies, Hypertension, Thyroid disease, Diabetes, Arthritis, and other autoimmune diseases.  Because of this, I am interested in a broad range of medical problems.  And I have a personal need to be an informed and knowledgeable patient, spouse of a patient, parent of patients, and family member for many patients.  I believe that a person should learn as much as they can about health problems so that they can be a partner and active participant in their own and family's health care.Sincerely,Ginny
Please could somebody tell me what GERD stands for?  Thankyou.
I have found this site very interesting and helpful however there is 1 question i would like to ask.Please tell me what GERD stands for,thankyou.
Dear Louise,GERD is Gastro Esophageal Reflux Disease.  Many people who suffer from recurrent, long standing heartburn are thought to have this disease.Sincerely,Ginny

question: Four days ago I was out of breath, unusual, during a light physical activity - two hours of golfing. I could not continue and eventually, after two hours, went to the emergency ward where they  measured a heart rate of 180 plus that subsided on its own. All tests blood, ECG indicated no heart attack. My question is I had been on the Dr. Atkins diet for 10 days - extreme low carb - could this cause an attack or is there the possiblity of another underlying cause?What is this condition called.
title: Rapid Heart Beat
